alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Cibola; Socorro; Valencia (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 2:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo, Socorro and Valencia. In west central New Mexico, Cibola. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms along Reservation Roads 54 and 55 within the Acoma Pueblo Indian Reservation. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Bernalillo, North Central Socorro, Northwestern Valencia and Southeastern Cibola Counties - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 128...and near Mile Marker 130, as well as portions of State Road 6. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
